Title: TV Presentation Skills for Youth
Description: Perhaps fame, stardom, and daily appearances on television screens are tempting to many, but they are not the essence of this profession. Television presenting is a significant responsibility, as the visual presence of the presenter on the screen represents the visual identity of the TV channel. Additionally, the presenter is the one who forms the visual communication channel with viewers and thus gains their trust. This course is designed to place the younger generation in front of the challenges and great responsibility facing the television presenters.
Prerequisites: • Age group between 10 and 16 years old. • Proficiency in the Arabic language. • Having motivation and desire to learn the TV presentation.
Objectives: By the end of this course, participants will:• Define the fundamentals of television presenting.• Develop television presenting skills.• Distinguish between news programs and talk shows.
Outline: • Fundamentals of TV work: - Key television terminology and visit the studio. - TV presenter's role and the different types of television programs. - TV production team and their roles. • TV presenter: - Important qualities of a TV presenter. - Basics of voice clarity for TV. - Physical attributes of a TV presenter. - Key tools and equipment used by presenters, such as the autocue, earpiece, and microphones. • Diverse TV programs: - Basics of a news presenter. - Effective news delivery and reading. - Mastering dialogue with guests in talk shows.
Benefits: • A graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

Title: TV Filming
Description: A television photojournalist is a journalist who conveys news and ideas through both visuals and sound, using video cameras. They are capable of executing various television works, including dramas, documentaries, news programs, and sports coverage, both in-studio and in the field. A television photojournalist should also be familiar with the nature of work in the digital media and computer technology fields, relying on a mastery of visual language and employing it to express emotions and translate ideas into visual content that viewers can easily understand. This course has been designed to help television photojournalists understand the foundations and principles of television filming. It aims to develop their visual sense and unleash their creativity, enabling them to tell stories through images that resonate with the audience.
Prerequisites: • High school diploma, a university degree is preferred.
Objectives: By the end of this course, participants will:• Identify the fundamentals and concepts of television filming. • Discuss techniques used in television filming. • Enhance quality of photography by applying dramatic and aesthetic concepts. • Differentiate between lighting techniques inside and outside the studio.
Outline: • Introduction to TV filming: - TV work environment and the role of a television photographer. - Concept of still photography and motion pictures and their relationship to realism. - Concept of visual language. - Primary and secondary colors. • Technical concepts in TV filming: - Light properties: reflection, refraction, and diffusion. - Types of cameras, their components, and their functions. - Concept of color temperature and its impact on the image. - Choose appropriate lenses and filters. • Dramatic and aesthetic concepts of filming: - Camera movements and rules for choosing shooting angles. - Lighting, visual elements, and rules of visual composition. - Changing focal length and its dramatic effect on the image. - Elements that affect the depth of field. • Filming and lighting inside and outside the studio: - Concept of indoor and outdoor lighting and the differences between them. - Artificial and natural lighting and the differences between them. - Filming and lighting interviews with multiple cameras inside the studio. - Filming outdoor scenes or interviews with natural lighting.
Benefits: • A graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

Title: The Art of Public Speaking
Description: There is no doubt that each of us has their own story that they want to communicate to the public. The value of these stories increases when they are related to the future of individuals and institutions, and the gains from promoting it. However, many people have important stories that they do not know how present to the public in an influential manner. At the top of these reasons is the fear and tension of facing the public. The biggest problem that they may not have a compelling story, and the most dangerous part is that they may not even realize it. Studies confirm that a few leaders and executives have remarkably relied on their stardom and distinction on their ability to speak to audience, influence them, and then convince them of their ideas and gain new supporters. Whether your speech is formal or informal, whether you hold a position or not, and regardless of the type and number of your audience, in this course, we will help you to make an impact, master the skills of effective communication, discover your independent speaking personality, and explore your potential for stardom.
Prerequisites: • High school diploma and above.
Objectives: By the end of this course, participants will:• Identify personal attributes in public speaking.• Prepare professional content and mental readiness.• Deliver professional performances in front of the public.• Differentiate between audience types and how to interact with them.
Outline: • Basic introductions: - Effective public speaking. - Foundation of charisma: innate or acquired. - Challenges of facing audiences. • Pre-confrontation: - Psychological and mental preparation. - Deal with tension and stiffness at the initial shock. - Prepare professional content. - Overcome fear right before the confrontation. • During confrontation: - Emotional stability and overcoming the fear of the beginning. - Build mutual feeling with the audience. - Handle unexpected situations. • Audience types: - Attract the audience. - Deal with audience questions. - Conclusion and leave an impact.
Benefits: • A graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

Title: Project Management
Description: Project management is a rapidly evolving global discipline. Companies are now focusing on managing their operations through a project-based approach rather than traditional methods to increase their focus on delivering high-level results within budget constraints and tight deadlines while meeting customer needs. With this growing emphasis on an organized project management approach, it's important for employees to be familiar with the fundamental principles and tools of project management. The project management course is designed to provide participants with the theoretical understanding and practical tools necessary for effective project management.
Prerequisites: • A minimum of 3 years of work experience.
Objectives: By the end of this course, participants will:• Differentiate between project management and operations management concepts.• Balance the project scope, budget, and scheduled time.• Analyze risks based on probability and impact and develop an appropriate response plan.
Outline: • Introduction to project management: - General definition of the project management concept. - Relationship between the project and the company's overall structure. - Differences between a project and operations, the project life cycle. • Executing the project scope: - Inputs, outputs, tools, and techniques within the project scope. - Determine the cost and time required for execution. • Risk identification and analysis: - Inputs, outputs, tools, and techniques for identifying project risks. - Develop an appropriate response plan for each risk. - Identifying means of communication within the project. - Establish quality control measures within the project.
Benefits: • A graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

Title: The Art of Public Speaking
Description: There is no doubt that each of us has their own story that they want to communicate to the public. The value of these stories increases when they are related to the future of individuals and institutions, and the gains from promoting it. However, many people have important stories that they do not know how present to the public in an influential manner. At the top of these reasons is the fear and tension of facing the public. The biggest problem that they may not have a compelling story, and the most dangerous part is that they may not even realize it. Studies confirm that a few leaders and executives have remarkably relied on their stardom and distinction on their ability to speak to audience, influence them, and then convince them of their ideas and gain new supporters. Whether your speech is formal or informal, whether you hold a position or not, and regardless of the type and number of your audience, in this course, we will help you to make an impact, master the skills of effective communication, discover your independent speaking personality, and explore your potential for stardom.
Prerequisites: • High school diploma and above.
Objectives: By the end of this course, participants will:• Identify personal attributes in public speaking.• Prepare professional content and mental readiness.• Deliver professional performances in front of the public.• Differentiate between audience types and how to interact with them.
Outline: • Basic introductions: - Effective public speaking. - Foundation of charisma: innate or acquired. - Challenges of facing audiences. • Pre-confrontation: - Psychological and mental preparation. - Deal with tension and stiffness at the initial shock. - Prepare professional content. - Overcome fear right before the confrontation. • During confrontation: - Emotional stability and overcoming the fear of the beginning. - Build mutual feeling with the audience. - Handle unexpected situations. • Audience types: - Attract the audience. - Deal with audience questions. - Conclusion and leave an impact.
Benefits: • A graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

Title: Personal Branding for Youth Workshop
Description: Personal branding is one of the most important tools that helps youth build a strong and influential image in both their personal and professional lives. This course aims to equip participants with an understanding of the importance of personal branding and how to use it to enhance their influence and build a positive reputation. By exploring personal strengths and developing self-confidence, participants will learn how to stand out and leave a lasting impression.
Prerequisites: • Age group between 10 and 16 years old. • Having the desire to improve personal skills.
Objectives: By the end of this workshop, participants will:• Clarify the importance of personal branding.• Discover strengths and enhance self-confidence.• Build a distinctive personality and leave a positive impression.
Outline: Introduction to personal branding: - Definition of personal branding. - Importance of personal branding. - Examples of influential personalities in Qatar. - Use digital platforms. Discover personal strengths: - Identify strengths. - The importance of self-confidence and the dangers of arrogance. - Distinction. Build a distinctive personal image: - The role of appearance in creating a first impression. - The importance of behavior in building reputation. - Leave a positive impact on others: presence, ethics, language, and charisma.
Benefits: • A graduation certificate from Aljazeera Media Institute.

Title: Spokesperson for Youth
Description: In this course, youth will acquire the essential skills needed to speak formally about their projects or institutions they belong to, enabling each of them to learn speaking skills with a clear voice, and how to present in front of an audience in press conferences.
Prerequisites: • Age group between 10 and 16 years old. • Having passion and desire to acquire speaking skills.
Objectives: By the end of this course, participants will:• Develop personal capacities for youth.• Use effective communication techniques to engage the audience's attention.• Enhance speaking and presentation skills in front of the camera.
Outline: • Confident speaking skills: - Characteristics and abilities of the speaker. - Topic selection and preparation. - Basics of clear voice delivery. • Communication power with the audience: - Effective communication skills. - Types of questions and responding to audience questions. - Interactive body performance. • Press conference: - Stand and speak in front of the camera. - Speak to the camera in public places.
Benefits: • A graduation certificate from Aljazeera Media Institute.

Title: Train the Trainer
Description: Many are the experiences that a person possesses, which they have acquired either through direct study and learning or through accumulated practical experience, or a combination of both. As a natural progression, a person may eventually feel that they have something valuable to offer to others. This leads to two fundamental questions: How can I transform this accumulated experience (both in terms of knowledge and practice) into a comprehensive training methodology that aligns with established training standards? How can I turn an abstract idea into an interactive exercise through which I can create a participatory and interactive environment to effectively and meaningfully convey knowledge, impart skills, and enhance beliefs and attitudes? This course systematically addresses these two questions.
Prerequisites: • Having knowledge and practical experience in a certain field. • Preferably having experience with any form of public speaking.
Objectives: By the end of this course, participants will:• Explain the comprehensive concept of the training process.• Design a training package.• Use training tools and exercises that serve training objectives.• Generate ideas for interactive exercises based on various training situations.• Deliver and present effectively.
Outline: • Comprehensive concept of the training process: - Foundations of successful training. - Characteristics of adult education. - Difference between standard education and training. - Presentation form of ideas. • Designing the training package: - Determine the training need. - Set goals based on need. - Write course outlines and enrich the content. - Execution and evaluation. • Training tools and methods: •• Tools: - Presentation slides. - Whiteboard. - Training cards. •• Methods: - Brainstorming. - Case Studies. - Working groups. - Other methods: role-playing, field games, discussions... • Presentation and speaking skills: - Body language. - Voice skills. - Words game.
Benefits: • A graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

Title: Meet the Press
Description: Meeting the Press course aims to effectively convey information to serve the objective goals of various institutions, whether they are governmental or private, through television, radio, newspapers, the internet, conferences, or any media that allows access to a wide audience. This course is designed to help individuals and responsible parties become familiar with the foundations and principles of dealing with the media in real-world situations. It also provides participants with many skills related to understanding media tools and media in general.
Prerequisites: • Desire or need to appear in the media for special reasons or for the needs and nature of work.
Objectives: By the end of this course, participants will:• Identify media tools and channels. • Handle interviews and press conferences effectively. • Use techniques of dealing with media.
Outline: • Introduction to media and its working mechanisms: - Types of media interviews. - Methods of preparing and organizing press conferences. - Media channels. • Press interviews and how to deal with them: - Press conferences. - Art of dealing with interviews. • Dealing with media techniques: - Design and develop a media message. - Ways to defend the situation. - Dealing in multi-guest interviews.
Benefits: • A graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

Title: Emotional Intelligence
Description: The ability to control emotions and manage one's feelings is the foundation of willpower and successful personal development. Emotion management is both a challenge and an urgent need at the same time because there are individuals with high intelligence levels who cannot effectively manage their emotional lives. Successful persons may fail in life due to their inability to control their emotions and motivations. Emotions drive thoughts, values, fears, and survival, and the ability to manage them correctly means getting out of crises and problems, while managing them negatively means getting immersed in them and thus negatively affecting the decisions. Therefore, this course is of particular importance for all professionals and employees, regardless of their field of work.
Prerequisites: • High school diploma or university degree. • Experience In teamwork.
Objectives: By the end of this course, participants will:• Define concepts of emotional intelligence.• Develop self-awareness and self-regulation skills.• Use emotional intelligence to improve personal relationships and social interactions.• Differentiate between emotional intelligence theories and their practical applications.
Outline: • Introduction and basic concepts: - Concept of emotional intelligence. - Importance of emotional intelligence in the workplace. - Elements and aspects of emotional intelligence. • Self-awareness and self-regulation: - Recognize emotions and manage them. - Self-regulation strategies and controlling emotions. - Deal with stress and resolve conflicts. • Personal relationships and empathy: - Empathy and its role in emotional intelligence. - Improve listening and communication skills. - Build positive relationships through emotional intelligence. - Teamwork, leadership, and emotional intelligence in workplace. • Theories of emotional intelligence improvement: - Goleman's Emotional Intelligence and its implications. - Karpman's Drama Triangle Theory. - Thomas-Kilmann Conflict Management Strategies.
Benefits: • A graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

Title: TV News Direction
Description: "You can't talk about direction without talking about creativity and vision." Visual works are produced by a team of creative people such as editor, photographer, screenwriter, lighting director, and others. Everyone has a clear and tangible role except the director, who has no clear work except to collect all these creations in a specific order to embody his visual vision in the work he does. He leads and manages the work in all its stages. So is the TV director who must embody his creativity, whether directly specialized in live programs or news and talk shows. This course will focus on news and program direction and will provide trainees with skills ranging from management, creativity, innovation and art, and will lay the groundwork for future directors.
Prerequisites: • University degree. • Simple or advanced technical experience in the field of television work.
Objectives: By the end of this course, participants will:• Identify the basics of TV direction. • Use direction techniques for television news. • Apply direction mechanisms for talk shows.
Outline: • Introduction to TV direction: - Principles and rules of TV direction. - The director's role and distinguishing qualities. - Work with the news bulletin and program production team. • TV news bulletins direction: - Direct and implement various types of bulletins with one or more presenters correctly. - Deal with guests, and the direction with multiple cameras or single camera. - Handle news when introducing guests via satellite, inside the studio, or over the phone. - Incorporate the reporters into the news bulletin, confirm the news and utilize their information. • TV talk shows direction: - Direct various talk shows formats and their connections to news or events. - Manage reporters and guest interviews in news-related programs. - Deal with dialogues and discussions in event-related programs. - Direction mechanisms with a single camera or multiple cameras.
Benefits: • A graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

Title: Modern Management Skills ( Online )
Description: One of the most essential requirements of the concept of management is to achieve the greatest possible results and reach your desired goals with the least resources, whether they are financial, human, technological, or others, in the shortest time and through the best methods. In other words, management means effectiveness on one hand, and it means efficiency and continuous performance improvement on the other. This course will set you on the right path, equipping you with the latest tools and methodologies to help you manage your businesses and projects in order to achieve your ambitions and successes.
Prerequisites: • High school diploma or university degree. • Professional experience in management.
Objectives: By the end of this course, participants will:• Define key modern management concepts.• Apply principles and concepts of Agile management.• Define the principles and importance of LEAN management. • Develop problem-solving, meeting management, and employee management skills.
Outline: • Foundational introductions: - Define key terms. - Modern angles of some traditional concepts. - Concepts of processes, procedures and policies (3Ps). • Agile management: - Main concept of agile management, basics, and rules. - Agile Management at the planning level. • Effective management (LEAN): - Main concept of effective management. - Analysis of processes and determining added value. • Basic skills: - Various thinking skills. - Problem-solving skills. - Decision-making skills. • Meeting management skills: - Basics of meeting management. - Skill of managing nominal groups physically and virtually. - Common mistakes in meeting management. • Employee management skills: - Situational management and motivation philosophy. - Team management foundations: physical, remotely and improve communication.
Benefits: • An electronic graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

Title: Davinci Resolve ( Evening )
Description: DaVinci Resolve is the only system that allows professional editors, colorists, visual effects artists, and sound engineers to work on the same project at the same time in one software tool.
Prerequisites: • Knowledge of Windows or Mac operating systems. • Basic understanding of editing terminology is preferred.
Objectives: By the end of this course, participants will:• Start a project with correct settings for any type of video clips.• Prepare and organize materials for editing.• Record audio and edit footage professionally.• Correct colors and add visual effects.
Outline: • Organize projects in DaVinci Resolve: - Getting to know the program interface. - Organizing a new project. • Initial preparation: - Entering materials into the program. - Introduction to montage via the Cut Page. - Sound mixing on the Cut Page. - Adding visual effects and transitions between shots. • Editing footage and audio: - Make a preliminary montage on the Edit Page. - Editing footage and repairing parts. - Working with sound on the Edit Page. - Mixing, sound processing, and voiceover recording via the Fairlight page. • Design and final output: - Add visual effects via the Fusion page. - Basic color correction using the Color page. - Export your final project in different formats to suit different needs. - Manage finished projects, project materials and organize your projects database.
Benefits: • A graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

Title: Media Executives' Presence Diploma ( Evening )
Description: Reaching or getting close to charisma in order to reach the power of influence sought by any official spokesperson, or a speaker to the media or in front of the public, requires an understanding of the art of media performance, which means presenting a live or recorded performance in a specific place and time in front of the audience or listeners, in which the image or the body of the performer and the content interact and harmonize to express feelings and ideas in order to reach the maximum degree of influence.
Prerequisites: • A university degree in media, public relations, or human science. • Media experience, preferably working in presentation or media fields. • Experience in the field of public relations.
Objectives: By the end of this diploma, participants will:• Discuss importance of visual language and communication in supporting media messages.• Analyze the basics of media performance.• Practice and develop media presence skills.• Write media speeches and press releases professionally.• Develop media communication skills and prepare for media interviews.
Outline: • Foundations and concepts of media presence: - Concept of media presence and qualities of the media personality. - Introduction to mass communication theory. - Visual language and spoken language and the relationship between them. - Analysis of whether charisma and influence power are a talent or acquired qualities. • Applications of media performance and media strategy: - Similarities and differences between speaking in public, speaking as a spokesperson, and speaking in the media. - Basic rules of logic. - Develop a media strategy. • Narrative and writing skills: - Press release. - News story and humanitarian story. - Public speaking. • Effective communication skills: - Preparation and the importance of the media team. - Interview, its types, and its objectives. - Effective dealing with any situation and any media platform. - Event preparation: preparing press releases and manage press conferences.
Benefits: • A graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

Title: Body Language for Media Professionals
Description: In the contemporary media world, body language has become an integral part of our daily communication, especially in the field of media where communication relies on more than just spoken words. A body language course for media professionals is a fundamental tool for developing communication skills and understanding verbal and non-verbal interactions that occur in the media environment. In this course, participants will be able to understand the role of body language in media, provide practical foundations for analyzing and using verbal and non-verbal signs effectively, thus improving their communication on screen and behind the scenes while interacting with the audience and guests.
Prerequisites: • Passion and interest in media. • Knowledge of the Arabic language.
Objectives: By the end of this course, participants will:• Analyze media body language and its importance.• Use body language effectively in front of the camera. • Develop methods of speaking and verbal communication.• Interpret facial expressions and their role in media.• Interpret meanings and implications of handshakes and body movements.
Outline: • Introduction to media body language: - Importance of body language in the media. - Role of body language in directing media messages. - Analyze the unique characteristics of body language in media environment. • Skills of dealing with camera: - Camera handling techniques to ensure good presentation in front of the camera. - Use body language to enhance presence and eye contact. - Confident expression on the screen. - Logical responses and avoid embarrassment. • Speaking style skills: - Importance of vocal style in effective media and communication. - Use speaking skills and voice as influencing tools. - Improve verbal communication with audience and guests. - Express and control emotions. • Semantics of facial expressions and eye contact: - Meanings of facial and eye expressions in media. - Role of visual communication in delivering media messages. - Visual expression techniques in dialogues and interviews. • Implications of handshakes and body movements: - Importance of handshake in media and public relations. - Meanings of body movements in media. - Fear signs on the body and how to overcome them.
Benefits: • A graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

Title: Writing for Multimedia
Description: In today's digital age, where information is consumed across a wide range of multimedia platforms, writing for multimedia is a skill that bridges the gap between traditional text-based communication and the dynamic, multimedia-rich world of online content. It is an essential tool for effective communication, storytelling, and engagement in the digital landscape. Whether you are a content creator or journalist, this course will enhance your ability to create compelling narratives for digital media, video, audio, and interactive content.
Prerequisites: • Experience in the digital field. • Anyone interested in creating multimedia content.
Objectives: By the end of this course, participants will:• Identify the principles of multimedia storytelling.• Develop writing skills for multimedia content.• Produce and edit multimedia content.• Create multimedia content across various platforms.
Outline: • Fundamentals of writing for multimedia: - Introduction to multimedia writing. - The role of storytelling in digital media. - Different multimedia platforms and their audiences. • Basics of scriptwriting: - Engaging multimedia scripts. - Write for video and audio. - Understand the role of visuals. - Select and incorporate images, videos, and audio. • Multimedia content production and editing: - Visual storytelling: photography and videography techniques. - Audio recording and editing techniques. - Add visuals, graphics, and effects to multimedia content. • Publishing and distributing multimedia content: - Understand the landscape of multimedia platforms. - Essential tools and software for multimedia production. - Prepare multimedia content for distribution. - Choose the right platforms for different multimedia formats.
Benefits: • A graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

Title: Commercial Promotional Films
Description: Promotional films serve as a testing ground for creative and innovative ideas, whether thinking about promoting a product or an idea. It is crucial to consider promotional campaigns and how to communicate through media. To reach and impact the largest audience, your ideas must be innovative and creative. But above all, you must be capable of creating provocative visual concepts. Only then, can you excel and succeed in this creative field.
Prerequisites: • University degree. • Experience in film production.
Objectives: By the end of this course, participants will:• Define concepts and fundamentals of commercial promotional films.• Develop and present ideas to clients.• Use techniques of filming, cameras, and lighting in various conditions.• Edit promotional films and publish them on social media platforms.
Outline: • Theoretical analytical introduction: - Commercial promotional films and their characteristics. - Forms and accepted lengths of advertising films. - History of commercial advertising films. - Analyze aesthetic and creative aspects of certain visual scenes in promotional films. • Idea development and presentation: - Edit and develop ideas. - Present ideas to clients and companies. - Pre-production phase, preparation, and script preparation. • Filming and shot design: - Filming techniques and working with the production team. - Modern techniques and visual effects in commercial film production. - Dealing with actors in commercial advertisements. • Final creative touches: - Set the appropriate frames and post-shooting footage editing. - Different aspects of post-production. - Promotion and distribution strategies across social networks.
Benefits: • A graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

Title: TV Documentary Production
Description: With the development of documentary television programs both regionally and globally, it has become essential for documentary producers, writers, and directors to possess competitive global professional tools. Therefore, this course is designed through practical exercises to enable the trainee to master the fundamentals of producing high-quality documentary television programs, whether informational or human-interest, political or social, in content and form, meeting international market standards.
Prerequisites: • University degree. • At least one-year of experience in media and production fields.
Objectives: By the end of this course, participants will:• Define the fundamentals of television documentaries.• Write and develop ideas and scenarios for television documentary programs.• Plan for documentary production and field filming.• Produce a television documentary program in collaboration with the production team.
Outline: • Introduction to TV documentary programs: - Documentary production schools. - Features and challenges of documentaries. - Documentary approaches and elements of television documentary programs. • Preparing television documentaries: - Developing the idea and documentary treatment. - Information and field research. - Pre-filming scenario. - Working with the team: roles and different tasks. • Field documentary production: - Production planning and field filming strategy. - Cinematic filming techniques. - Camera and using the microphone. - Fundamentals of interviewing art. • Post-production phases: - Scenario building in television documentary programs. - Writing and recording documentary commentary. - Fundamentals of editing and music. - Information verification and evaluation of the first program copy. - Visual, audio, graphics, coloring, and final touches effects. - Plan the show for broadcasting or publishing.
Benefits: • A graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute. • A graduation project.

Title: Media Discourse Analysis
Description: Media discourse analysis involves a systematic examination of the media message and the methods through which language, visual reports, and other elements are used to convey content to the audience. This course, through concentrated theoretical explanations and practical applications, will help participants understand how the media conveys impactful messages to the public. It will empower them to engage with media content with a critical perspective.
Prerequisites: • University degree in media or journalism. • Practical experience in media fields.
Objectives: By the end of this course, participants will:• Define the concepts of media discourse and apply discourse analysis tools.• Analyze how media discourse is constructed and composed, and interact with its content.• Deconstruct the concept of public opinion, its components, functions, types, and how it is influenced.• Apply and use tools and techniques for media discourse analysis.
Outline: • Introduction to media discourse analysis: - Deconstruct the concepts of discourse and analyzing discourse. - Types of discourses and the position of media discourse within them. - Clarify the features of templates used in journalism. • Deconstruct elements of media discourse: - Elements of the communication process. - Analyze language and structure of media texts and their temporal and political context. - Analyze the concept of news and news reports, their components, and sources. • Impact and shape the public opinion: - Identify news sources. - Identify influential news institutions worldwide. - Types of articles, editorials, angles, and their role in shaping public opinion. • Practical applications: - Review the production of a select group of article writers, columnists, cartoonists. - Practice and apply tools for the analysis of media discourse.
Benefits: • A graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

Title: Corporate Planning and Management ( Online )
Description: Planning and managing corporates represent a vital balance between creativity and innovation on one hand, and commitment to professional administrative principles on the other. This balance requires developing the institution's orientations and aligning its projects and programs with its objectives, while considering the needs and aspirations of its clients and target audience. Excelling in leading and implementing this balance is the key to success for any institutional work and the excellence of any organization. Therefore, planning and managing institutions require leaders characterized by creativity and smart leadership, who value the importance of human capital and trust their surrounding team. This course aims to equip participants with the fundamental foundations for success and excellence in the field of planning and managing institutions, revealing to them the necessary steps for efficiently managing available resources to achieve maximum results.
Prerequisites: • University degree in management, economics or media is preferred. • Minimum of three years of experience in a leadership or administrative field is preferred. • Desire and a high willingness to think, analyze, develop and create.
Objectives: By the end of this course, participants will: • Explain and analyze the fundamental concepts of planning and management. • Apply principles of strategic and emergency planning in the organizational context. • Compare different types of organizational structures for institutions.• Use the necessary tools for effective organizational change management.
Outline: • Fundamentals and principles of planning and management: - Concept of planning and management and their importance. - Basic principles of planning and management. - Key terms in planning and management. - Build the governing document. • Strategic planning and emergency planning: - Components of strategic planning. - Strategic planning using SWOT, TOWS, Pfieffer, and BSCs. - Develop the strategic business model and set strategic initiatives. - Operational planning: definition, steps, forms, and its consistency with the strategic plan. - Emergency planning and developing alternative plans: concept and applications. • Organizing and structuring institutions: - Organize and structure the institutions: principles, types, and advantages. - Lead institutions: basic principles, competencies, and styles. - Human resources and develop the training plans. - Advantages and disadvantages of different organizational structures. • Change management: - Understand resistance to change. - Organizational change management strategies.
Benefits: • An electronic graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

Title: Screen Design ( Evening )
Description: Screen design course focuses on the principles and techniques of creating attractive and user-friendly digital interfaces for screen-based platforms. In this course, trainees will learn how to design interfaces that are visually aesthetic and optimized to fit with the user experience. In addition to learning how to use design elements, color theory, fonts, layout, and interactive components to create effective screen designs.
Prerequisites: • High school diploma, university degree is preferred. • Basic computer experience.
Objectives: By the end of this course, participants will:• Define the basics of screen design. • Use design methods for an engaging visual experience. • Apply various design programs.
Outline: • Introduction to screen design: - Understand the basics of design. - Basic aesthetic principles of design. - Understand user interfaces in websites and applications. - Principles of user needs analysis. • Effective interface design: - Principles of designing effective user interfaces. - Design interfaces adapted to various screen sizes and devices. - Improve user experience. • Design tools and software: - Design fonts and backgrounds using Photoshop. - Design logos and icons using Illustrator. - Design interactive interfaces and practice them with Adobe XD. - Export designs and design elements for the team and developers.
Benefits: • A graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

Title: Voice Placement and Elocution Skills ( Evening )
Description: "Make your voice heard." The news may be extremely important, but it won't capture the audience's (listener or viewer) attention if it's presented poorly. Therefore, this course suggests to radio and television presenters, as well as professionals in various media fields, to work on improving their vocal abilities. It provides them with theoretical knowledge and technical means that enable them to be aware of their voice, own it, and trains it to serve the content they want to convey to the audience.
Prerequisites: • High school diploma and above. • General culture and especially media culture. • Mastering of the Arabic language.
Objectives: By the end of this course, participants will:• Identify the importance and components of voice.• Use voice control techniques.• Develop performance skills for the voice and control it.• Present in a manner that captures the audience's attention.
Outline: • Concept and components of voice: - Importance of the voice. - Voice characteristics and its effect on the receiver. - Voice and its relationship to personality, mental state and self-confidence. • Control and mastery of voice: - Breathing form the diaphragm. - Relaxation, concentration and control of fear and emotions. - Voice expression: - Vocal layer. - Voice strength and presence. - Voice rhythm, speed, and dynamics. - Tone and vocal image. • Presentation and elocution: - Articulation and pronunciation. - Text segmentation and stress points in sentences.
Benefits: • A graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

Title: TV Presentation Workshop ( Evening )
Description: The media profession and television presentation in particular constitutes a temptation for many to try to know the world of television, some do it out of curiosity to find out the details of this exciting work, while others do it because they believe they have what it takes to become successful television presenters.

Title: Introduction to TV Presentation
Description: Fame and stardom in the television industry has often tempted many to explore the world of television and even try the experience of presentation. Some do it out of curiosity to know about the details of this exciting job, while others are motivated by the belief that they have what it takes to become a future presenter on one of the TV channels.
Prerequisites: • Professional experience in a field dealing with audiences. • University degree in media.
Objectives: By the end of this course, participants will:• Identify the basics of TV presentation.• Distinguish the qualities of a successful presenter.• Apply TV presentation techniques.
Outline: • Introduction to TV: - Studio and newsroom. - Relationship between the presenter and the editorial and technical teams. - Role of the TV presenter. • Qualities of the presenter: - Charisma, presence and voice. - Serenity, promptness and concentration. • Skills of TV presentation: - Language and expression proficiency. - Good interlocutor and control of the subject. - Good control of the body language and readiness to contingencies. - Dealing with the autocue, earpiece, and the relationship with the director.
Benefits: • A graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

Title: Creative TV Reports
Description: Unlike traditional news reports that focus solely on conveying facts and information, creative TV reports aim to evoke emotions, captivate audiences, and provide a deeper understanding of the subject matter. In this course, participants will develop storytelling techniques, research and scripting skills, and effective interviewing methods to create compelling television stories that captivate audience.
Prerequisites: • University degree. • At least one year of experience in the media field.
Objectives: By the end of this course, participants will:• Identify the principles of creative storytelling in television reporting.• Develop advanced research and scripting techniques for television reports.• Use techniques of interviewing, on-camera presentation, and visual storytelling. • Develop skills to enhance the visual and narrative aspects of TV reports.• Explore ethical considerations and challenges in television reporting.
Outline: • Foundations of creative TV reporting: - Introduction to creative storytelling in television. - Elements of a captivating TV report. - Analyze effective TV reports. • Research and scripting for TV reports: - Conduct in-depth research for TV reports. - Write engaging scripts and narratives. • Interviewing and on-camera presentation: - The art of effective interviews. - Enhance on-camera presentation skills. - Visual storytelling techniques. • Visual and narrative aspects: - Creative storyboarding techniques. - Effective visual composition. - Visual elements for impactful reporting. • Ethics in TV reporting: - The Importance of ethical journalism. - Addressing sensitive topics in TV journalism. - Ethical guidelines and codes of conduct in journalism.
Benefits: • A graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

Title: Infographics
Description: Conveying the message to readers effectively represents an essential skill that every journalist must acquire. With the evolution of digital media and mobile communication, there is an opportunity to visually convey your story or news. The field of infographics combines information and graphic design, so this course helps professionals in the digital field to conceptualize their ideas and convey them using images and visual information. Participants will learn the necessary skills within the realm of information visualization and design.
Prerequisites: • Experience in journalism and digital fields.
Objectives: By the end of this course, participants will:• Identify the fundamentals of visual information design.• Define the stages of working in visual information design.• Develop skills in information design and create simplified visual elements.
Outline: • Introduction to visual information design: - Concept of infographics. - Role of visual storytelling. - Types of design: static, zooming, animated, interactive, video. • Work stages: - Story definition and narrative construction. - Trends in visual storytelling. - Data collection, sorting, and analysis techniques. - Data validation and review before and during design, and before publishing. • Working on visual information design without a designer: - Design infographics using Canva and Illustrator. - Use timelines, mapping, and illustrate them. - Basics of animating infographics using After Effects. - Export and publish static or animated designs across various platforms.
Benefits: • A graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

Title: Investigative Programs Production
Description: Investigative programs are vital in uncovering and addressing issues of public interest, ensuring that the truth is revealed. This course will equip aspiring investigative journalists, documentary filmmakers, and media professionals with the skills and knowledge to create impactful and compelling content that uncovers hidden truths and advocates for positive change.
Prerequisites: • University degree in media. • Practical experience in media.
Objectives: By the end of this course, participants will:• Identify the fundamentals of investigative journalism.• Use research techniques effectively.• Clarify the steps for planning and executing investigative program episodes.• Explore the legal and ethical aspects of investigative journalism.
Outline: • Introduction to investigative journalism: - Definition of investigative journalism. - Importance of investigative journalism. - History of investigative journalism. - Difference between investigative journalism and other news coverage. • Develop ideas for investigative programs: - Sources of investigative program ideas and how to develop them. - How to conduct research. - Elements of good research. - Hypothesis formulation. • Plan the program episode: - Planning and the methodology for investigative programs. - Treatment; its importance, elements, and how to write it. - Documenting evidence in investigative programs. • Execute investigative programs: - Sources in investigative programs; digital, physical, and human sources. - Interviews in investigative programs; with victims, experts, and officials and decision-makers. - Confrontation in investigative programs. • Legal and ethical considerations: - Quality control in investigative programs. - Handle legal aspects in investigative programs. - Ethical aspects in investigative programs.
Benefits: • A graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

Title: Train the Trainer
Description: Many are the experiences that a person possesses, which they have acquired either through direct study and learning or through accumulated practical experience, or a combination of both. As a natural progression, a person may eventually feel that they have something valuable to offer to others. This leads to two fundamental questions: How can I transform this accumulated experience (both in terms of knowledge and practice) into a comprehensive training methodology that aligns with established training standards? How can I turn an abstract idea into an interactive exercise through which I can create a participatory and interactive environment to effectively and meaningfully convey knowledge, impart skills, and enhance beliefs and attitudes? This course systematically addresses these two questions.
Prerequisites: • Having knowledge and practical experience in a certain field. • Preferably having experience with any form of public speaking.
Objectives: By the end of this course, participants will:• Explain the comprehensive concept of the training process.• Design a training package.• Use training tools and exercises that serve training objectives.• Generate ideas for interactive exercises based on various training situations.• Deliver and present effectively.
Outline: • Comprehensive concept of the training process: - Foundations of successful training. - Characteristics of adult education. - Difference between standard education and training. - Presentation form of ideas. • Designing the training package: - Determine the training need. - Set goals based on need. - Write course outlines and enrich the content. - Execution and evaluation. • Training tools and methods: •• Tools: - Presentation slides. - Whiteboard. - Training cards. •• Methods: - Brainstorming. - Case Studies. - Working groups. - Other methods: role-playing, field games, discussions... • Presentation and speaking skills: - Body language. - Voice skills. - Words game.
Benefits: • A graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

Title: The Art of Public Speaking ( Online )
Description: There is no doubt that each of us has their own story that they want to communicate to the public. The value of these stories increases when they are related to the future of individuals and institutions, and the gains from promoting it. However, many people have important stories that they do not know how to present to the public in an influential manner. At the top of these reasons is the fear and tension of facing the public. The biggest problem is that they may not have a compelling story, and the most dangerous part is that they may not even realize it. Whether your speech is formal or informal, whether you hold a position or not, and regardless of the type and number of your audience, in this course, we will help you to make an impact, master the skills of effective communication, discover your independent speaking personality, and explore your potential for stardom.
Prerequisites: • High school degree and above.
Objectives: By the end of this course, participants will: • Identify personal attributes in public speaking. • Prepare professional content and mental readiness. • Deliver professional performances in front of the public.
Outline: • Basic introductions: - Effective public speaking. - Challenges of facing audiences. • Pre-confrontation: - Psychological and mental preparation. - Deal with tension and stiffness at the initial shock. - Prepare professional content. - Overcome the fear right before the confrontation. • During confrontation: - Emotional stability and overcoming the fear of the beginning. - Build a mutual feeling with the audience. - Handle unexpected situations. - Conclusion and leave an impact.
Benefits: • An electronic graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

Title: Press Conference Management Workshop ( Evening )
Description: Press conferences are vital platforms for spreading information, addressing the media, and shaping public perception. Whether you are a spokesperson, communications professional, or a public relations specialist, mastering the art of press conference management is essential for enhancing your communication strategies. This workshop will equip the participants with the techniques to enhance their skills in effectively presenting press conferences and dealing with media.
Prerequisites: • Desire or need to appear in the media for special reasons or for the needs and nature of work.
Objectives: By the end of this workshop, participants will:• Plan for the press conference. • Identify the basics of press conference management. • Use techniques of dealing with media.
Outline: • Prepare for the press conference: - Identify the objectives of the press conference. - Draft the press conference speech and define the targeted messages. - Types of press conferences: unilateral, bilateral, multi-party. - Distribute speaking roles and time among speakers in a multi-party conference. • Logistic preparation phase: - Prepare press materials. - Book the conference venue. - Send invitations to the media. • Dealing with the media: - Measure journalists' engagement with the press conference. - Handle tough questions and situations. - Side interviews on the sidelines of the press conference. - Crisis management stage and the importance of supporting entities.
Benefits: • A participation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

Title: Organizational Communication Skills ( Evening )
Description: We cannot imagine an institution without an effective internal communication at all management levels. Strength, success, harmony, productivity, and efficiency in work primarily depend on the effectiveness of organizational communication skills. However, before anything else, employees in these institutions need to possess internal and external communication skills built on scientific, accurate, and realistic foundations. Based on that, this course offers various techniques and skills to support the capabilities of public relations employees and others who constantly communicate with individuals and are exposed to different situations.
Prerequisites: • University degree in media, business management or marketing. • Some experience in public relations.
Objectives: By the end of this course, participants will:• Define communication fundamentals and its relation to organization's objectives. • Build a comprehensive strategy and plan for effective communication. • Implement internal and external communication plans within the organization.
Outline: • Introduction to organizational communication: - Communication theories and using them to strengthen corporate communication. - Role of public relations department in building communication channels. - Communication channels which comply with organization's strategic objectives. - Develop personal communication skills and enhancing capabilities. • Organizational communication strategy: - Function of communication within the organization. - Evaluate the communication techniques in the organization. - Determine the internal and external communication strategy for the organization. • Implementing a communication plan and procedures: - Evaluate the organization’s communication system. - Evaluate information content. - Design a new communication plan. - Communication tools for internal motivation. - Combine external communication resources.
Benefits: • A graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

Title: TV Talk Show Presentation
Description: “Dialogue is the deepest thing in television news and programming.” This quote summarizes the importance of TV talk shows to all TV journalists and not only to presenters. Television work in all its forms relies on dialogue in some news reports and talk shows, which require participants with knowledge and culture, in addition to a high level of professionalism in performance, the ability to extract information and convey it to the audience, and continuous interaction with news and with what the guests are saying.
Prerequisites: • University degree in media. • At least one-year media experience for non-media graduates.
Objectives: By the end of this course, participants will:• Explore the television work environment.• Identify the fundamentals of talk shows.• Build talk show programs and create dialogues.• Master skills of dialogue control effectively.
Outline: • TV work environment: - Teamwork environment in TV programs. - Relationship between producer, director, presenter and other working teams. - Preparing TV programs and relationship between preparation and presentation. - Successful preparation of the talk show and guest selection. • Fundamentals of talk shows: - Basic qualities of talk show presenters. - Key differences between talk show presenters and news presenters. - Types of talk shows. - Importance of dialogue and its forms in TV work. • Building a talk show: - Introduction, content and conclusion. - Prepare the introduction and its importance in the talk show. - Building the dialogue and the main subjects. - Essential tools for the art of making questions. • Skills of TV show presentation: - Searching methods and tools. - Dialogue control and ability to maneuver to achieve goals. - Techniques to overcome mistakes. - Dealing with body language.
Benefits: • A graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

Title: Train the Trainer
Description: Many are the experiences that a person possesses, which they have acquired either through direct study and learning or through accumulated practical experience, or a combination of both. As a natural progression, a person may eventually feel that they have something valuable to offer to others. This leads to two fundamental...

Title: Mobile Field Reports
Description: Mobile technology has revolutionized the way news is gathered, reported, and consumed, making it a critical tool for journalists worldwide. For this reason, mobile field reporting is becoming increasingly important in modern journalism due to their ability to deliver timely, cost-effective, and flexible coverage from virtually anywhere. This course will empower participants to become proficient in capturing, editing, and presenting field reports on various subjects.
Prerequisites: • University degree in journalism. • Practical experience in journalism field.
Objectives: By the end of this course, participants will:• Identify the foundations of journalism and field reports and their requirements.• Explore tools, equipment, and applications for producing mobile field reports.• Apply field report production techniques at all stages, leading to creative practice. • Use the principles of storytelling and narrative processing via mobile phones.
Outline: • Introduction to mobile field reporting: - Overview of the current landscape of field journalism. - Field reports, their types, and their role in feeding newsrooms and digital platforms. - Ethical considerations and intellectual property rights in mobile reports. - Deal with challenges, difficult situations, and how to address them. • Mobile reporting tools: - Select the appropriate phone, its specifications, the necessary accessories and assisting equipment. - Camera operation and settings for field reporting. - Recording clear audio and using external microphones. • Field reporting techniques: - Planning, filming, and recording audio. - Editing and graphics. - Verification mechanisms. - Publish and monitor interaction. • Storytelling and editing on mobile devices: - The concept of storytelling and its stages in mobile journalism. - Write scripts and structure the field reports. - Add context and narrative to reports. - Mobile video editing techniques and software.
Benefits: • A graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

Title: Crisis Management
Description: Crisis management is one of the most important and challenging fields within organizations and institutions today. With the increasing challenges and unexpected circumstances, forming teams capable of effectively addressing and managing crises becomes vital. This course aims to provide a comprehensive framework for developing the skills and knowledge necessary to understand, assess, and manage crises effectively. Participants will learn how to prepare for unexpected challenges, analyze risks, engage with media and the public, as well as organize field operations and provide the necessary legal support.
Prerequisites: • University degree in media, management or marketing. • Practicing public relations profession.
Objectives: By the end of this course, participants will:• Define the concept of crisis and the importance of preparing for it.• Analyze risks and understand the impact of crises on organizations.• Enhance communication skills and understand legal aspects of crisis management.• Develop response skills and leadership abilities in crisis environments.
Outline: • Introduction to crisis management: - Definition of a crisis and its various types. - The importance of preparing and responding to crises. - Build effective crisis management teams. • Risk assessment: - Fundamentals of risk analysis and identify sensitive points. - Use tools and techniques for risk assessment. - Analyze the impact of crises on organizational performance. • Media and legal management of crises: - Importance of effective communication during crises. - Strategies for communicating with the media and the public. - Laws and regulations governing crisis and emergency management. - Legal obligations for institutions during crises. • Field management of crises: - Response strategies in the field. - Organize and plan field operations to deal with emergencies. - Select and train members of the field team. - Role of leadership and effective communication in guiding teams during crises.
Benefits: • A graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

Title: Protocol and Etiquette ( Online )
Description: The unique and outstanding positive image is the goal of all local and international institutions. This image is created through various protocol procedures, which are based on formulating innovative thinking within the framework of the international protocol methodology. This training program addresses the arts of etiquette and protocol from diverse perspectives, featuring comprehensive topics aimed at bridging the gaps resulting from the conflict and contrast between ceremonial procedures that are not built on international scientific principles and foreign and national VIPs who deal with the organization during their visits or interactions.
Prerequisites: • University degree, preference is given to graduates of media colleges, or an intermediate qualification with the condition of working in public relations.
Objectives: By the end of this course, participants will: • Define the comprehensive concept of the modern international protocol. • Identify fundamentals of etiquette and protocol for meetings and official visits. • Analyze the gestures and general etiquette related to protocol and etiquette.
Outline: • General concepts: - Protocol history and competencies. - Modern concept of the international protocol and its sources. - Organize protocol management in modern organizations. - Official dining etiquette. • Various approaches to international protocol: - Etiquette and international protocol for meetings and interviews. - International model for planning and implementing official visits for VIPs. - International protocol for organizing official banquets and arranging guests. - International rules for the protocol for arranging invitees in parties and official events. - International protocol for organizing international, regional and local conferences. • General elegance and lifestyle: - Gestures that affect your elegance. - Characteristics of an elegant person. - General etiquette.
Benefits: • An electronic graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

Title: Illustrator Advanced ( Evening )
Description: Adobe Illustrator CC is an essential design tool for anyone who needs to express their ideas visually in print, on websites, or on any other way. This course, which is the perfect blend of the Instructor's hands-on explanation and trainee practical application, allows you to dive into the finer details of many different techniques and tools.
Prerequisites: • Completion of the Illustrator Basics course or a minimum of one year of practical experience with the Illustrator. • Completion of the Photoshop Basics course or a minimum of one year of practical experience with Photoshop.
Objectives: By the end of this course, participants will:• Use advanced skills and tools in design.• Design graphics suitable for websites.• Create illustrative graphics and 3D elements.
Outline: • Advanced tools and effects: - Add effects to design elements. - Work with advanced mask technology. - Understand the details of the Appearance panel. - Use and understand the Mesh tool. • Digital design: - Understand website graphics. - Save the design for websites and videos. - Export the working file correctly to Adobe After Effects. • 3D graphic design: - Design illustrations (infographics). - Design 3D elements. - Apply styles and methods to shapes and texts.
Benefits: • A graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute accredited by Adobe.

Title: Media Culture Workshop ( Evening )
Description: In the current world, the media plays an increasing role in shaping our culture and society. The media is everywhere and has the power to influence our beliefs, values and behaviors. Therefore, it is essential that we understand the impact of media on our culture and develop critical thinking skills to evaluate media content and the messages it conveys.
Prerequisites: • Interest in the media field.
Objectives: By the end of this workshop, participants will:• Study the interaction between media, communication, and their impact on culture.• Analyze the influence of geographical factors on media and culture.• Discuss the impact of media on political geography and vice versa.
Outline: • Introduction to media culture: - Impact of media on culture. - Interaction between media and communication. - Analyze media contexts. • Geography and its impact on media and global culture: - Major geographical regions in the world: geographical and cultural distribution. - General and specific characteristics of each region. - Social, political, economic, and security issues in each region. - Different social and cultural formations related to media. • Mutual impact of media and political geography: - Impact of media on political geography. - Impact of political geography on media. - Regional conflicts and international challenges.
Benefits: • A participation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

Title: TV Correspondent Skills
Description: Wherever people celebrate their joys and share their sorrows, and wherever there are important events or raging conflicts, there is the reporter. They are the eye with which we see these events and the ear with which we hear about them. They are the individuals who overcome obstacles and sometimes defy danger to bring us the truth. In fact, TV reporting is one of the most physically taxing television jobs, but certainly one of the most exciting and interesting ones. This course is designed to arm participants with the necessary professional tools of journalism, whether written or visual, so they can convey the truth to the public with honesty and objectivity.
Prerequisites: • University degree in journalism. • A one-year journalism experience for non-media graduates.
Objectives: By the end of this course, participants will:• Discuss the nature of television journalism.• Explore the steps in field reporting preparation.• Define visual language concepts and their relationship with text.• Develop television news skills to deliver effective messages.
Outline: • Introduction to TV work fundamentals: - Principles and characteristics of journalism and its ethics. - Templates for television news processing. - Journalist's relationship with the production team; camera operator and editor. - TV news production. • Mechanisms of TV report preparation: - Methodology for preparing field TV reports. - Conduct interviews for television reports (form and content). • Creative and technical skills: - Basic principles and techniques of filming and editing. - Aesthetic concept of editing and visual composition. - Importance of natural sounds in the TV report. - Writing for picture. • Parallel TV news skills: - Presentation skills and standing in front of the camera. - Correspondent's live TV message. - Walk and Talk. - Emergency Issues and how to deal with them.
Benefits: • A graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

Title: Meet the Press ( Advanced )
Description: In our rapidly evolving world, the role of media in shaping public opinion and debates has become more important than ever, as the power of media and journalism converge to form a dynamic and engaging experience. Whether you are a public figure, a spokesperson, or part of a public relations team, mastering the art of dealing with media is essential for conveying your message, managing audience perception, and building a successful public image. In this course, the trainee will have the confidence, knowledge and tools to deal with the media efficiently.
Prerequisites: • Completion of basic “Meet the Press” course. • The need to appear in the media.
Objectives: By the end of this course, participants will:• Develop skills for dealing with interviews and media conferences.• Master advanced media skills. • Distinguish between global media schools.
Outline: • Raise the challenge level in interviews; models and videos: - Press conferences, from logistical preparation to post-conference actions. - Answer the media questions professionally. - Different media channels and how to deal with them. - Handle mistakes after they occur. • Advanced skills in dealing with media: - Content and message development. - Importance of presentation, body language and public speaking skills. - Techniques to avoid answering embarrassing questions. - Mechanisms for deflecting answers. • Difference between classical and modern media schools: - Arab School. - Anglo-Saxon School. - Francophone School.
Benefits: • A graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

Title: Film Photography Essay
Description: The significant advancement in the production, preservation, and archiving of photographic images has led to the emergence of a new artistic genre called "Photo-Essay Film." It is a literary, philosophical, or aesthetic essay resulting from the interplay of ideas sparked by the author's self-cultural experience and the vision of visual images, or the visions that go beyond what is immediately visible in the image. The outcome is a story, an essay, or a text accompanied by titles that establishes an aesthetic or philosophical relationship with the image, transcending it into an aesthetic or spiritual background for the text. In this course, participants will learn how to derive text from images and photographic stories to create distinctive artistic expressive works.
Prerequisites: • High school diploma or university degree. • Experience and knowledge in photography.
Objectives: By the end of this course, participants will:• Define the fundamentals and concepts of photographic essay films.• Develop creative photography skills professionally.• Analyze components of photographic essay films and apply them.• Write an essay based on ideas derived from a deep reading of the image.• Discuss artistic elements of photographic essay films and how to utilize them.
Outline: • Introduction to film photography essay: - Concept of essay. - Boundaries between photographic essay films and visual storytelling, and reportage. - Aesthetic and philosophical difference between visual presentation of images and photographic film. - Visual storytelling with images. • Creativity in photography and its concept: - Visual composition: blocks, light and shadow, perspective, lines. - Visual construction of the photographic story. - Tools used in photography and treatment. - Deep and analytical reading of the image. • Components of film photography essay: - Narrative essay text. - Images that form a visual story. - Quality standards and image attractiveness. - Locations for shooting and their impact on the photographic story. • Artistic elements of photographic essay films: - Procedural process and linking information and events. - Visual sequence and internal relationships between shots. - The interconnection between images and text.
Benefits: • A graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute. • A graduation project: photo-essay film.

Title: Basics of Simultaneous Interpreting
Description: The scientific and technological progress achieved in our modern era surpasses and removes all barriers that hinder communication between different people and nations worldwide, except for the language barrier. This is where the importance of translation becomes apparent, as it is the only means to overcome obstacles to understanding and promote cultural and intellectual exchange between humans. Therefore, the significance of this profession, particularly simultaneous interpretation, becomes evident. Hence, there is a necessity to organize courses for simultaneous translation to prepare qualified Arabic translators to practice simultaneous interpretation in international conferences and meetings.
Prerequisites: • University degree, preferably in the English language. • Mastering the English and the Arabic languages. • At least one year experience in translation.
Objectives: By the end of this course, participants will:• Develop translation skills and requirements.• Use the concept of simultaneous interpretation and apply its principles.• Define the concept of editorial translation.
Outline: • Translator and the translation: - Linguistic and cultural requirements for translators. - Specifications and standards of good translation. - Short-term memory. - Equipment and tools of the simultaneous translation. • Introduction to simultaneous translation: - Concept of simultaneous translation, principles, and requirements. - Types of simultaneous translation: consecutive, simultaneous, whispered. - Cognitive processes in consecutive translation: understanding, analyzing, rephrasing. - Taking notes while doing consecutive translation. - Skill of listening and talking at the same time. • Introduction to written translation: - Concept of written translation. - Linguistic and non-linguistic difficulties that hinder translation.
Benefits: • A graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

Title: Image Building and Reputation Management
Description: Mental image of the institution is one of the foundations of its success, given its great importance in supporting the achievement of its mission, vision and strategic objectives, and protecting its reputation from accusations, rumors and intrigues. Moreover, it contributes to increasing the target audience’s satisfaction and addressing their reactions and enhancing their demand for the institution’s products or services. This helps guide all the organization's teams to participate in the process of maintaining and developing its mental image on local, regional, and international levels.
Prerequisites: • University degree in media, business management or marketing. • Some experience in public relations.
Objectives: By the end of this course, participants will:• Discuss the fundamentals of mental image and its outcomes.• Develop effective strategies and plans for managing mental images.• Implement and enhance mental image plans.
Outline: • Introduction to understanding mental imagery: - Concept of mental image and its importance. - Types of mental image and the relevant stakeholders. - Outcomes associated with mental image. - Obstacles in building, supporting, and developing mental image. • Mental image planning: - The starting points of planning mental image. - Fields of mental image planning. - Annual plan of the mental image. • Mental image management: - Areas of managing mental image. - Concept of institutional reputation. - Manage and preserve organizational reputation. • Develop institutional mental image.
Benefits: • A graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media Institute.

Title: Drone Filming
Description: In recent times, we have witnessed more drones flying in the sky, and people, especially journalists, have shown increasing interest in them. They are not only concerned about how they fly but also about how to use them. Since 2013, journalism has increasingly turned to using drones to provide more contextual options, such as size, capacity, and flexibility. At present, drones are almost ready for flight, but is that all there is to it? No, because the number of drone users has significantly increased, and there is a growing concern about protecting this new industry from restrictions. Journalists, like hobbyists, need to be aware of the rules and safety procedures specific to this field.
Prerequisites: • High school or university degree. • Basic experience in the field of photography. • Interests in the technological field.
Objectives: By the end of this course, participants will:• Follow checklists and safety procedures when using drones.• Identify the rules for operating drones.• Apply basic maintenance procedures.
Outline: • Controls for using drones: - Pre-flight checklist for drones. - Safety and regulations/guidelines. • Simulating the drone flight: - Best camera settings for aerial photography. - Recommendations and how to choose the appropriate system. - Identifying the best shots for storytelling. • Basic maintenance procedures for safe operations: - Maintain and store LIPO batteries. - Achieving camera gimbal balance. - Sensor calibration (compass). - Replacing broken propellers.
Benefits: • A graduation certificate by Aljazeera Media institute.

Title: Voice Placement and Elocution Skills ( Online )
Description: “Make your voice heard." The news may be extremely important, but it won't capture the audience's (listener or viewer) attention if it's presented poorly. Therefore, this course suggests to radio and television presenters, as well as professionals in various media fields, to work on improving their vocal abilities. It provides them with theoretical knowledge and technical means that enable them to be aware of their voice, own it, and trains it to serve the content they want to convey to the audience.
Prerequisites: • High school diploma and above. • General culture and especially media culture. • Mastering of the Arabic language.
Objectives: By the end of this course, participants will: • Identify the importance and components of the voice. • Use voice control techniques. • Develop performance skills for the voice and control it. • Present in a manner that captures the audience's attention.
